channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Constant Fly tipping, 19th November
item.description:
For years a pile of residential rubbish appears in the same spot. Today I witnessed this man in blue empty his entire bin. He came from the property opposite.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kersley Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin has been overflowing for 4 days now, 19th November
item.description:
Bin overflowing since the weekend, wind is blowing rubbish everywhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Needleman Street, Rotherhithe, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Concerns About Delayed Leaf Clearance in the area, 19th November
item.description:
We are now at the end of November, with most of the leaves on the ground, and with so many trees around, neither the streets nor the pavements have been cleaned. Especially after the rain, the leaves are going into the drains, which could cause blockages. It appears that this service is being delayed year on year. When will the leaves be cleared in this area?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Road, Sundridge, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken down vehicle blocking traffic flow, 19th November
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle between 80 Goddard Road and 66 upper Elmer’s end road. This vehicle has been left for well over a month, there’s a sign on the rear window claiming they’ve broken down and have gone for help - it’s been like 5 weeks. It’s blocking traffic flow and an accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goddard Road, Elmers End, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandon Vehicle, 19th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Road, Sundridge, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 re Rosendale Playin, 19th November
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 re Rosendale Playing Fields north entrance ie opposite side of the road to house number 211. Enamel type sign attached to the fence tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4441859,-0.0978304,3a,75y,66.2h,86t/data=!3m8!1e1!3m6!1snFXNA6mmWYT8pebLZ3g7tA!2e0!5s20220801T000000!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D4.0042677033708%26panoid%3DnFXNA6mmWYT8pebLZ3g7tA%26yaw%3D66.20000980727642!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTExNi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosendale Road, Tulse Hill, London Borough of Lambeth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building materials obstructing the road, 19th November
item.description:
The builders who are currently working at 49 St Aidans Road are using the street as storage for all of their building materials, these include timber, blocks, plaster board and have a skip. It is taking up at least six car lengths and is a hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, St Aidan's Road, East Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Smellty and filthy Subway food waste, 19th November
item.description:
Dear Southwark Council, This Subway branch ALWAYS takes and leaves out their (smelly!) food waste, whenever they want. I commute this road every day. Every single morning Subway leave on the pavement bags full of organic waste, and continue doing so through the day, whenever they need to. We beg you to address this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Borough High Street, The Borough, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipped rubbish outside shops, 19th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pembroke Road, Northumberland Heath, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
